Defeating Coco Gauff in straight sets, the four-time major champion has embraced motherhood, mental health battles, and a joyful comeback on her beloved Arthur Ashe Stadium.

description: Anand Mahindra lauded Kittammal V, an 82-year-old powerlifter from Tamil Nadu, for her remarkable achievements in state-level competitions. Defying age stereotypes, she inspires many by outperforming younger athletes with her dedication to fitness and a traditional South Indian diet. Her story highlights the importance of resilience and challenges conventional views on aging in India.

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded strongly to alleged abuses against his late mother during a Congress-RJD rally in Bihar, stating it insulted all women. He expressed that the people of Bihar shared his pain and condemned the remarks. Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar also criticized the incident, calling the language used against PM Modi and his mother "utterly deplorable."

Bahrain to open Hajj registration tomorrow: Key details
description: Bahrain will open online registration for the 1447 AH (2026) Hajj season on September 3 via official Hajj platform closing on September 16. Applicants must register through the eKey system, hold a valid ID, and may include four companions. Accepted pilgrims can select campaigns from September 16 and pay BD 150. Health and ID verification are mandatory.

Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson’s real estate empire: Inside his lavish mansions
description: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson owns many luxurious properties. His real estate includes a Beverly Hills mansion with city views. He has a Georgia farm with rustic charm. Johnson also owns a Florida villa for relaxation. These homes show his taste for luxury. The properties reflect his lifestyle and success. Each estate serves a specific purpose for his family and career.

title: Discount grows: Russian crude gets even cheaper for India; New Delhi continues to resist US pressure
description: India is facing increased pressure from the US over its growing Russian oil imports, leading to a 50% tariff imposed by the Trump administration. Despite widening discounts on Russian Urals crude, making it cheaper than US alternatives, the US accuses India of funding Russia's war in Ukraine through these purchases.

Gurgaon to 'Gurujam': Traffic snarls, broken roads; 10 viral videos capture rain chaos
description: Gurgaon faced chaos on Monday. Heavy rainfall caused roads to submerge. Vehicles stalled, leading to severe traffic jams. Key areas like IFFCO Chowk and Hero Honda Chowk were heavily affected. Commuters experienced hours-long delays. Emergency services struggled to navigate the flooded streets. The city's drainage issues were highlighted once again. Residents are demanding better infrastructure.

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Semicon India 2025, emphasizing India's ambition to become a semiconductor hub. He received the first made-in-India Vikram 32-bit processor and highlighted the nation's commitment through reforms and investments. Modi envisions India as a key player, designing, manufacturing, and exporting trusted semiconductors globally, driving significant change and economic growth.

The post sparked a flurry of reactions, with users pointing out the actual age gap and commenting on the relationship.

'Put it in container': Pak defence minister’s solution for floods; calls excess water 'blessing'
description: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif suggested citizens store floodwater as a blessing amid severe flooding in Punjab province, which has claimed 33 lives and displaced over 700,000 residents. Punjab is experiencing its biggest flood in history, impacting two million people and threatening food security due to crop damage. Monsoon rains have been excessive, leading to widespread devastation across the country.

title: KCET 2025: KEA revises round two counselling schedule; check new dates
Rape case: AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra arrested; flees after firing at police
description: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra was arrested by Patiala police in connection with a rape case, sparking political turmoil. Pathanmajra claims the arrest is retaliation for criticizing the party's Delhi leadership, alleging they are undermining Punjab leaders and ignoring local issues. He urged supporters to protest, accusing the Delhi leadership of remote-controlling Punjab and punishing dissent.

title: Semicon India 2025: PM Modi receives first made-in-India chip 'Vikram'
description: Prime Minister Modi received India's first indigenous semiconductor chip, the Vikram processor, at Semicon India 2025. Union IT Minister Vaishnaw highlighted the rapid progress driven by the India Semiconductor Mission, with five units under construction and significant investment committed. Industry leaders praised India's growing role and potential in the global semiconductor market, projecting substantial growth and collaboration.

title: Despite 'economic selfishness': PM Modi hails India's 7.8% GDP growth; takes veiled dig at Trump
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted India's impressive 7.8% GDP growth, achieved amidst global economic concerns fueled by what he termed "economic selfishness," a likely reference to US trade policies. This statement comes after the US imposed significant tariffs on Indian exports and targeted India's Russian oil purchases, escalating trade tensions between the two nations.

description: Donald Trump's claims of a disastrous trade relationship with India are challenged by a GTRI analysis, revealing a $35-40 billion surplus for the US when considering all earnings. The US benefits significantly from tech, finance, and education sectors in India. India's proposed tariff concessions are generous, and its decisions on oil and defence are based on national interests.

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to visit Mizoram and Manipur on September 13, as officials said, marking his first visit to Manipur since ethnic tensions escalated in May 2023. In Mizoram, he is expected to inaugurate a railway line connecting Aizawl with Silchar, Assam, as part of the Act East Policy.

NASA’s first view of Earth from the Moon: A photo that changed how we see home
description: In 1966, NASA's Lunar Orbiter 1 captured the first image of Earth from the Moon. This photograph showed Earth as a fragile sphere. It changed humanity's perspective. The Lunar Orbiter program aimed to map the Moon for Apollo landings. Engineers captured the Earth image. The restored image revealed more details. This view sparked discussions about Earth's fragility.

Gold price prediction today: Rates hit new highs - where are they headed?
description: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are surging, driven by expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts and geopolitical uncertainties. Spot gold reached $3,475, while MCX October gold hit Rs 104,724. Analysts suggest buying on dips, anticipating a test of the all-time high at $3,500, with potential resistance at $3,650 and support at $3,450.

title: Vote 'chori' row: BJP steps up attack on Congress; claims Pawan Khera has 2 voter ID cards
description: The BJP has accused Congress leader Pawan Khera of possessing two voter ID cards, prompting calls for an Election Commission investigation into potential electoral law violations. This accusation coincides with Rahul Gandhi's intensified criticism of the government, alleging "vote theft" during the recent "Voter Adhikar Yatra" in Bihar.

title: Haryana Police neutralised 13 dangerous criminals in 110 encounters since Jan 2024
'Threw India ties aside for Pak business': Ex-US NSA blasts Trump; calls it a 'huge strategic harm'
description: Former NSA Jake Sullivan accuses Donald Trump of prioritizing his family's business interests in Pakistan over strengthening ties with India, calling it a strategic blunder. Sullivan suggests Trump's actions, including potential Bitcoin deals and trade agreements with Pakistan, undermine US credibility and worry allies. He highlights the importance of a strong US-India relationship to counter China.

title: Strikes across Gaza kill at least 31 as international scholars accuse Israel of genocide
Ashes blow for Australia? Pat Cummins ruled out of India, New Zealand series with lower back injury
AAP MLA Harmit Singh Pathanmajra says security withdrawn, day after he slammed irrigation secy, govt
When Sharmila Tagore spoke about her love story with Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi: ‘Angrezi me kya bolte the kuch samajh hi nahi aaraha tha’
'They have caused an issue by bringing Gill into T20': Ex India star drops bombshell
description: Robin Uthappa suggests Shubman Gill's selection for the T20I Asia Cup and his vice-captaincy might be influenced by star power and marketing considerations, despite his recent strong Test performance. Uthappa believes that India has a history of backing superstars, and Gill's inclusion aligns with this trend, especially after a successful IPL 2025 season.

title: Jitesh Sharma Exclusive: A small-town boy, who keeps and is blooming in finisher's role
description: Jitesh Sharma scored only 261 runs in Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) title-winning season, but it was not the runs that caught the selectors’ eyes, it was his 176.35 strike rate while batting at 6 and 7. Jitesh, who never had a coach, learnt cricket by watching YouTube videos of his childhood heroes Adam Gilchrist and Sourav Ganguly. Making a comeback into the Indian team at the age of 31 is as breathtaking as his cricketing sojourn.

title: ‘If you arrest us ...': Jarange warns Fadnavis govt; vows to stay till demands met
description: Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange has warned of intensified protests in Mumbai, with more Marathas expected to arrive over the weekend. Jarange cautioned authorities against arrests or lathi charges, threatening severe consequences. Mumbai Police rejected a renewed request for agitation at Azad Maidan, citing violations and court directives.

title: Exclusive | 'I tried to live as a man but': First-ever trans chess player to reach WIM
description: Yosha Iglesias, once a chess prodigy in Sochi, Russia, has made history as the first transgender woman to win the French women's chess championship. Overcoming personal struggles, including a difficult transition and online harassment, Yosha found strength in her chess community and Buddhist philosophy. Her journey, marked by resilience and self-acceptance, inspires others to embrace their true selves.

title: 'Shame': Trump trade adviser's fresh attack on India after RIC huddle at SCO; takes jibe at PM Modi
description: Peter Navarro criticized PM Modi for aligning with Putin and Xi Jinping at the SCO summit, urging India to support Europe and Ukraine and cease purchasing Russian oil. He accused India of "profiteering" from refined Russian oil sales and labeled the conflict as "Modi's war." The US has imposed tariffs on India, which New Delhi deems "unjustified."

title: Delhi-NCR rains: Thousands stuck in massive Gurgaon traffic snarl; watch video
description: Gurgaon faced severe traffic disruptions on Monday due to waterlogged roads and numerous vehicle breakdowns. Commuters experienced extensive delays, particularly on the Delhi-Jaipur Expressway and key intersections. The traffic police responded to around 200 distress calls, deploying personnel and cranes to manage the chaos.

title: Ahmedabad school murder: Bag checks expose hidden student world; blades, vapes, booze, condoms found
description: Following a fatal stabbing at an Ahmedabad school, surprise bag checks have revealed alarming items carried by students. Schools are finding lighters, vapes, and even alcohol, alongside concerning items like blades and contraceptives. Psychologists attribute this to peer pressure and exposure to adult content, while counselors highlight the influence of violent media and easy access to addictive substances at home.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on leaving college: Parents reaction; money lessons
description: Lucy Guo, the world's youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her early entrepreneurial spirit to her frugal upbringing. Despite her parents' emphasis on academics, she dropped out of Carnegie Mellon to pursue the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's childhood hustles, from selling Pokémon cards to creating online gaming tools, laid the foundation for her success with companies like Scale AI and Passes.

title: Chhattisgarh rain fury: IAF airlifts man stranded for 12 hours in flooded Shabari river
description: A man was successfully rescued from the flood-swollen Shabari river near Nadigufa–Telavarti after being stranded for over 12 hours. A joint operation by the Indian Air Force, Sukma district administration, police, and CRPF was launched after strong currents hampered initial rescue attempts. Drones pinpointed the man's location, leading to an airlift operation.

title: Trademark fight in India: Bombay HC to Cognizant; You cannot use logo till case ends
description: The Bombay High Court has reinstated a ban on Cognizant's use of its logo in India, pending the resolution of a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by Atyati Technologies. This decision overturns a previous order that had allowed Cognizant to continue using the logo.
